parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the shell command table.
Pointer to the static list of commands.
Number of commands in the list.

briefdescription.para: Frees or resets the command table.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the command table.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of registered commands.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the command table.
Pointer to the command table.
Command index.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the command descriptor or NULL if out-of-bounds.

briefdescription.para: Finds a command by its name.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the command table.
Command name string.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the matching command descriptor or NULL if not found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const WshShellCmd_t *pcCmd, WshShell_Size_t argc, const WshShell_Char_t *pArgv[], WshShell_Size_t rights, WshShell_Size_t *pTokenPos)
memberdef.name: WshShellCmd_ParseOpt

briefdescription.para: Parses a command-line option for a given shell command.

detaileddescription.para: This function analyzes the current token in the argument list and attempts to identify a valid option defined in the given command's option table. If a valid option is found, its descriptor is returned. The token position (*pTokenPos) is advanced accordingly depending on the number of arguments that the option consumes.
If only the command name is present (i.e., argc == 1), the function checks for an option of type WSH_SHELL_OPTION_NO (indicating the command may be executed without any parameters).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the shell command definition.
Number of arguments in the input array.
Array of argument strings.
User rights bitmask for access check.
Pointer to the current token position in pArgv. Will be updated to point past the parsed option.

simplesect.para: A filled option descriptor if a matching option is found, or an empty descriptor if not.

memberdef.argsstring: (WshShellOption_Ctx_t *pOptCtx, WshShell_Size_t argc, const WshShell_Char_t *pArgv[], WshShell_Size_t valueSize, void *pValue)
memberdef.name: WshShellCmd_GetOptValue

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the value associated with a parsed command option.

detaileddescription.para:
This function extracts the value of a command-line option parsed by WshShellCmd_ParseOpt(), based on its type. Supported types include:
WSH_SHELL_OPTION_STR → copied to pValue as a string
WSH_SHELL_OPTION_INT → parsed as integer and written to pValue
WSH_SHELL_OPTION_FLOAT→ parsed as float and written to pValue
The function expects the option to be followed by its value in pArgv. All other option types return WSH_SHELL_RET_STATE_ERR_EMPTY.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to parsed option descriptor.
Argument count.
Argument vector (array of strings).
Maximum size of the output buffer (used for strings).
Output buffer for value (string/int/float based on type).

simplesect.para: WSH_SHELL_RET_STATE_SUCCESS if value was successfully retrieved,
WSH_SHELL_RET_STATE_ERR_PARAM if input parameters are invalid,
WSH_SHELL_RET_STATE_ERR_EMPTY if the option doesn't accept a value,
WSH_SHELL_RET_STATE_ERR_OVERFLOW if argument list is too short.

briefdescription.para: Prints detailed information about a shell command and its options.

detaileddescription.para:
This function outputs the help text and a formatted table describing each available option for the specified command. For each option, the following fields are printed:
Short name
Long name
Option type (e.g., INT, STR, FLOAT)
Access flags (read/write/etc.)
Description/help string
Options of type WSH_SHELL_OPTION_NO and WSH_SHELL_OPTION_WAITS_INPUT are skipped.
This is typically used for displaying help information when a user requests --help for a specific command.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the command descriptor whose options should be printed.
